attribution.translator: Kanani Mana. Hawaiian Text edited by Puakea Nogelmeier

content.verses:
[
    [0] {
      order: 1
      type: verse
      hawaiian_text: 
      | Listen to Green Carnation on YouTube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CJBAgW6iHtY
      | Kuʻu ipo, kuʻu pua, kuʻu lei
      | Green carnation onaona
      | Wili ʻia me maile lau liʻi
      | Lei nani makamae
      | Liʻa wau i kou nani
      | Hoa pili no mī nei
      | Lei mai ana iaʻu kou aloha
      | Hoʻi mai kāua e pili
      english_text: 
      | My sweetheart, my blossom, my wreath
      | Green carnation, so alluring
      | Entwined with small leaf maile
      | Wreath so beautiful, so precious
      | I desire your beauty
      | Won`t you be my companion
      | I am blessed with your love
      | Come, let us be together
      hawaiian_lines: [Listen to Green Carnation on YouTube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CJBAgW6iHtY, Kuʻu ipo, kuʻu pua, kuʻu lei, Green carnation onaona, Wili ʻia me maile lau liʻi, Lei nani makamae, Liʻa wau i kou nani, Hoa pili no mī nei, Lei mai ana iaʻu kou aloha, Hoʻi mai kāua e pili]
      english_lines: [My sweetheart, my blossom, my wreath, Green carnation, so alluring, Entwined with small leaf maile, Wreath so beautiful, so precious, I desire your beauty, Won`t you be my companion, I am blessed with your love, Come, let us be together]
    }
  ]
